message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atrial muscle and ventricular muscle have faster propagation velocities than AV node and Purkinje system. Among the options, only (B) has the correct ordering of velocities for each region.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The order of action potential propagation velocity from highest to lowest is: Purkinje system, ventricular muscle, atrial muscle, and AV node. Therefore, the set of measurements that corresponds to the correct order is (B) 1.1 m/s, 0.05 m/s, 2.2 m/s, 0.3 m/s.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The atrial muscle has a slower velocity than the ventricular muscle so options C and D can be eliminated. The AV Node has the slowest velocity, followed by the Purkinje system, and then the ventricular muscle, so option A can be eliminated. The correct order is AV Node (0.05 m/s) < Purkinje system (2.2 m/s) < ventricular muscle (0.3 m/s). Therefore, the only option that follows this order is (B).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atrial muscle conducts at a slower velocity than ventricular muscle, with a velocity of 1.1 m/s. AV node has the slowest conductivity at 0.05 m/s. Purkinje fibers conduct at 2.2 m/s and ventricular muscle has a conduction velocity of 0.3 m/s. Therefore, the correct set of measurements is (1.1 m/s, 0.05 m/s, 2.2 m/s, 0.3 m/s). Answer choice (B) matches these values.

We refer to our knowledge of cardiac physiology for help. Atrial muscle and ventricular muscle have faster action potential propagation velocities compared to the AV node and Purkinje system. Therefore, the highest velocity belongs to ventricular muscle and the lowest velocity belongs to the AV node. This eliminates options A and C. Between options B and D, option B represents the correct sequence of increasing velocities from AV node to Purkinje system to atrial muscle to ventricular muscle, consistent with the normal propagation pathway of the heart.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atrial muscle conduction velocity is typically slower than ventricular muscle conduction velocity and therefore has the slowest velocity of 1.1 m/s. The AV node is typically the slowest part of the conduction system and has a velocity of 0.05 m/s. The Purkinje system has a velocity of 2.2 m/s and the ventricular muscle has the fastest velocity of 0.3 m/s. Therefore, the correct set of measurements is (1.1 m/s, 0.05 m/s, 2.2 m/s, 0.3 m/s), which is option (B).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Action potential propagation velocity varies in different regions of the heart. In the atrial muscle, it is typically around 1.0-1.1 m/s. In the AV node, it's slower and is around 0.05 m/s. In the Purkinje system, it's faster and is around 2.2-2.5 m/s. In the ventricular muscle, it's typically around 0.3-0.4 m/s. Therefore, the corresponding velocities for atrial muscle, AV Node, Purkinje system, and ventricular muscle would be 1.1 m/s, 0.05 m/s, 2.2 m/s, and 0.3 m/s respectively, which matches option (B).

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Action potential propagation velocity varies in different regions of the heart. In the atrial muscle, it is typically around 1 m/s to 1.5 m/s. In the AV node, it is much slower, typically around 0.03 m/s to 0.05 m/s. In the Purkinje system, it is faster, around 2 m/s to 4 m/s. In the ventricular muscle, it is typically around 1 m/s to 1.5 m/s. Among the options, only (B) matches these values: 1.1 m/s for atrial muscle, 0.05 m/s for AV node, 2.2 m/s for Purkinje system, and 0.3 m/s for ventricular muscle.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Atrial muscle has the slowest conduction velocity, followed by the AV node, Purkinje system, and finally ventricular muscle. Answer B fits this order with velocities of 1.1 m/s, 0.05 m/s, 2.2 m/s, and 0.3 m/s, respectively.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The order of action potential propagation velocity from fastest to slowest is Purkinje system, ventricular muscle, atrial muscle, and AV node. The answer choice that matches this order is (B), with velocities of 1.1 m/s for atrial muscle, 0.05 m/s for AV Node, 2.2 m/s for Purkinje system, and 0.3 m/s for ventricular muscle.
